articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pounded Rafah with airstrikes and tank fire on Tuesday, pressing its offensive in Gaza's southern city despite international condemnation of an attack that sparked a blaze in a tent camp for the displaced, killing at least 45 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces press Rafah offensive despite global outcry

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The Biden administration on Tuesday said it was closely monitoring the probe into a deadly Israeli airstrike it called beyond tragic, but that the recent deaths in Rafah didn't constitute a major operation there that crosses red lines.
articles.title: US says latest Rafah deaths won't impact Israel policy, military aid
Rare spat shows China, North Korea still at odds on nuclear weapons

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Angelo Amante
articles.description: When Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni took power in 2022, far-right parties across Europe hailed her victory, expecting the fiery new leader in Rome to pursue a nationalist agenda and battle the Brussels bureaucracy.
articles.title: Once ostracised, Italy's Meloni is now centre stage in Europe

articles.author: Praveen Menon
articles.description: Families in Yambali village in Papua New Guinea were sleeping peacefully in their beds when a "mountain" of rubble buried them alive in a gigantic landslide, said a U.N. rescue worker at the disaster site and the country's prime minister.
articles.title: 'A mountain fell on them' says rescue worker at PNG landslide site

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military drills last week were more about propaganda and intimidation than starting a war, but Chinese forces did show how they could react extremely quickly, Taiwan's top security official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Taiwan says China drills more about intimidation, propaganda than starting war

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is set to arrive in the Moldovan capital Chisinau on Wednesday, the first stop of a brief Europe tour during which he will aim to solidify the Western support for Ukraine across NATO allies and neighboring countries.
articles.title: Blinken travels to Eastern Europe as tensions with Russia build

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea has warned residents living near the border with North Korea to be on alert after media reports said more than 90 balloons carrying various objects including what appeared to be trash and excrement had been detected.
articles.title: South Korea on alert for balloons dropping trash from North

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Hong Kong's High Court is set hand down a verdict this week against 16 democrats in a landmark subversion trial that critics say could have major repercussions for the city's opposition democratic movement and the global financial hub's reputation.
articles.title: Hong Kong democrats brace for landmark verdict after lengthy legal battle

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's attorney-general will indict former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra for allegedly insulting the monarchy, an official said on Wednesday, in a setback to a political heavyweight whose loyalists are currently in government.
articles.title: Thailand to indict influential former premier Thaksin over royal insult
